sponsor: Hospital General de Ni√±os Pedro de Elizalde
briefTitle: Variation in Natremia Using Two Different Maintenance Intravenous Fluids in Postsurgical Hospitalized Children
officialTitle: Variation in Natremia Using Two Different Maintenance Intravenous Fluids in Postsurgical Hospitalized Children
summary: The primary objective of this study is to compare the blood sodium level after 12 hours following the initiation of therapy with either 0.3% NaCl/dextrose 5% or 0.45% NaCl/dextrose 5%, in postsurgical hospitalized children requiring maintenance IV fluid administration.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Change from baseline in sodium level after 12 hours
